content:
TITLE: Setting Custom Data Directory in Shell Profile
DESCRIPTION: This snippet modifies the shell profile (e.g., `~/.profile`) to set a custom data directory path for asdf by exporting the `ASDF_DATA_DIR` environment variable. It allows users to customize where asdf stores its data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
export ASDF_DATA_DIR="/your/custom/data/dir"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Tool Versions in .tool-versions Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: Defines desired versions of tools in a directory using the .tool-versions file. Supports comments and multiple versions separated by spaces. Versions can be specified as exact versions, git refs, local paths, or system default. This file controls which tool versions asdf activates within a directory and subdirectories. Typical usage involves plain text files with each tool and version on a line.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/manage/configuration.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
ruby 2.5.3
nodejs 10.15.0
```

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
ruby 2.5.3 # This is a comment
# This is another comment
nodejs 10.15.0
```

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
python 3.7.2 2.7.15 system
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing a Specific Version with ASDF
DESCRIPTION: Installs a specific version of a tool using ASDF. You can specify a version number or use a git reference (branch, tag, or commit) for source-based installations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/manage/versions.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf install <name> <version>
# asdf install erlang 17.3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Tool Version with asdf set Command in Shell
DESCRIPTION: This shell command sets a specific version of a tool (e.g., nodejs 16.5.0) to be used globally or for the current directory. It updates the appropriate `.tool-versions` file (either in home directory or working directory) to specify the desired version, enabling consistent environment setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf set -u nodejs 16.5.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install asdf using Homebrew Shell
DESCRIPTION: Installs the asdf version manager using the Homebrew package manager on macOS or Linux. This is the recommended installation method. Requires Homebrew to be installed and configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
brew install asdf
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing ASDF Version Shell
DESCRIPTION: Install the specific version of a single tool as it is defined in the `.tool-versions` file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/internal/help/help.txt#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
asdf install <name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configure asdf completions source for Nushell Nushell
DESCRIPTION: Sources the generated asdf completion script in Nushell to enable command completions. It dynamically determines the location of the completion file based on the `ASDF_DATA_DIR` variable. This block should be added to `~/.config/nushell/config.nu`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: Nushell
CODE:
```
let asdf_data_dir = (
  if ( $env | get --ignore-errors ASDF_DATA_DIR | is-empty ) {
    $env.HOME | path join '.asdf'
  } else {
    $env.ASDF_DATA_DIR
  }
)
. "$asdf_data_dir/completions/nushell.nu"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating a Specific ASDF Plugin
DESCRIPTION: This command updates a specified ASDF plugin to its latest version. It fetches the newest commits from the plugin's repository. Requires the plugin's name as an argument.  The `<name>` parameter identifies the plugin to be updated. This updates only the specified plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/zh-hans/manage/plugins.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf plugin update <name>
# asdf plugin update erlang
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configure asdf custom data directory for Bash Shell
DESCRIPTION: Specifies a custom directory for asdf to store its data, plugins, installs, and shims in Bash. This overrides the default `$HOME/.asdf` location. This line should be added to `~/.bash_profile` before the PATH configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
export ASDF_DATA_DIR="/your/custom/data/dir"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting current version globally, locally, or in shell
DESCRIPTION: Configures the active version of a tool by setting it globally, locally within a project directory, or temporarily in the shell session. Supports latest version references.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ko-kr/manage/versions.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf global <name> <version> [<version>...]
# Example: asdf global elixir 1.2.4

asdf shell <name> <version> [<version>...]
# asdf shell elixir 1.2.4

asdf local <name> <version> [<version>...]
# asdf local elixir 1.2.4

# Using latest: 
asdf global <name> latest[:<version>]
# Example: asdf global elixir latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Global asdf Package Version (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Sets the default global version for a package in `$HOME/.tool-versions`. Accepts a specific version or 'latest' (optionally with a version prefix like 'latest:16').
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/help.txt#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
asdf global <name> <version>
asdf global <name> latest[:<version>]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configure asdf shims path for Elvish Shell
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the system's PATH environment variable in Elvish shell. It checks for the `ASDF_DATA_DIR` variable to determine the correct directory. This block should be added to `~/.config/elvish/rc.elv`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: Elvish
CODE:
```
var asdf_data_dir = ~'/.asdf'
if (and (has-env ASDF_DATA_DIR) (!=s $E:ASDF_DATA_DIR '')) {
  set asdf_data_dir = $E:ASDF_DATA_DIR
}

if (not (has-value $paths $asdf_data_dir'/shims')) {
  set paths = [$path $@paths]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Latest Stable Version with ASDF
DESCRIPTION: Installs the latest stable version of a tool using ASDF. Can be used without any version prefix or with a prefix to install the latest within a specific version range.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/manage/versions.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf install <name> latest
# asdf install erlang latest
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf install <name> latest:<version>
# asdf install erlang latest:17
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install asdf with Go
DESCRIPTION: Installs asdf using `go install`.  Requires Go to be installed.  This is a quick method to get asdf set up.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
go install github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/cmd/asdf@v0.16.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Latest ASDF Version Shell
DESCRIPTION: Install the latest stable version of a package. An optional version string prefix can be provided to install the latest stable version that matches the prefix.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/internal/help/help.txt#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
asdf install <name> latest[:<version>]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing a Specific Version of Node.js Using asdf
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the latest available version of Node.js using asdf. The `latest` keyword resolves dynamically to the most recent version at execution time, facilitating easy upgrades.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_28

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf install nodejs latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install asdf using Zypper Shell
DESCRIPTION: Installs the asdf version manager using the Zypper package manager, commonly found on openSUSE and SUSE Linux Enterprise. This method simplifies installation via a system package manager. Requires Zypper to be installed and configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
zypper install asdf
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using the system version of a tool instead of asdf-managed versions - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure asdf to use the system-installed version of a tool by setting the version to 'system' via global, local, or shell commands. This lets users override asdf management to use the underlying system default.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/zh-hans/manage/versions.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf local <name> system
# asdf local python system
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Debugging and System Info with asdf (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Provides system, shell, and asdf debugging information output via 'asdf info', useful for troubleshooting and system reports.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/manage/core.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf info
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add asdf to Bash profile (Git)
DESCRIPTION: This command adds the asdf initialization script to the ~/.bashrc file so asdf is available in new terminal sessions. It assumes asdf was installed via git.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started-legacy.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
. "$HOME/.asdf/asdf.sh"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Showing Latest Stable Version with ASDF
DESCRIPTION: Displays the latest stable version of a tool. Can optionally show the latest version that begins with a specific version string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/manage/versions.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf latest <name>
# asdf latest erlang
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf latest <name> <version>
# asdf latest erlang 17
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Uninstalling an asdf Package Version (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Removes a specific installed version of a package. Requires the package name and the exact version string to uninstall.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/help.txt#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
asdf uninstall <name> <version>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Latest Tool Version with asdf (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to install the latest stable version of a tool using asdf. The first command installs the latest Python version, while the second installs the latest Python 3.7 version. It relies on the 'asdf install' command and the 'latest' keyword.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
asdf install python latest
asdf install python latest:3.7 # installs latest Python 3.7 version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add asdf to Bash profile (Homebrew macOS)
DESCRIPTION: Adds asdf initialization script to the ~/.bash_profile using the path provided by `brew --prefix asdf`. This ensures asdf is available in new terminal sessions when installed via Homebrew.  macOS Catalina or newer if not using ZSH.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started-legacy.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
echo -e "\n. \"$(brew --prefix asdf)/libexec/asdf.sh\"" >> ~/.bash_profile
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install asdf completions for Elvish Shell
DESCRIPTION: Generates the asdf shell completion script for Elvish and appends it to the Elvish RC file. This command needs to be run manually once after installing asdf. Requires the `asdf` executable to be in the PATH.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
asdf completion elvish >> ~/.config/elvish/rc.elv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing the Latest Stable Tool Version with asdf (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Installs the latest available stable version of a specified tool using `asdf install <name> latest`. Replace `<name>` with the tool name (e.g., `erlang`).
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/manage/versions.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf install <name> latest
# asdf install erlang latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Tool Versions in .tool-versions
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the format of the `.tool-versions` file, which specifies the versions of tools to be used in a directory and its subdirectories. It includes examples for specifying exact versions, tags, commits, and custom paths. It also shows how to specify a fallback versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/manage/configuration.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
ruby 2.5.3
nodejs 10.15.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Global Tool Version with asdf
DESCRIPTION: This command sets the global version of a tool (e.g., nodejs) using asdf. It modifies the `$HOME/.tool-versions` file.  The `latest` keyword instructs asdf to use the latest version available.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/zh-hans/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf global nodejs latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Clone asdf Repository via Git
DESCRIPTION: This command clones the asdf repository from GitHub to the ~/.asdf directory using git. It specifies the v0.15.0 branch. This is the recommended method for downloading asdf.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started-legacy.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf.git ~/.asdf --branch v0.15.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Local asdf Package Version (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Sets the package version in the nearest `.tool-versions` file (searching upwards from the current directory). Creates the file if it doesn't exist. Accepts a specific version or 'latest' (optionally with a version prefix).
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/help.txt#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
asdf local <name> <version>
asdf local <name> latest[:<version>]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting a Default Node.js Version for all Directories
DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets a global default Node.js version (`16.5.0`) by updating the `.tool-versions` associated with the user. The `-u` flag applies the version across all directories unless overridden locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_29

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf set -u nodejs 16.5.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Latest Stable Version Matching Prefix with asdf (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Installs the latest stable version of a tool that starts with a specific prefix using `asdf install <name> latest:<version>`. Replace `<name>` with the tool name (e.g., `erlang`) and `<version>` with the prefix (e.g., `17`).
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/manage/versions.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf install <name> latest:<version>
# asdf install erlang latest:17
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining User Configuration in .asdfrc Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: The .asdfrc file sets user-specific settings for asdf behavior such as legacy version file support, keeping downloads, plugin sync frequency, disabling plugin repo sync, and compilation concurrency. It is a key=value formatted plaintext file typically located at ${HOME}/.asdfrc or a path set by ASDF_CONFIG_FILE. This file enables customization of plugin synchronization, caching, and performance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/manage/configuration.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
legacy_version_file = no
use_release_candidates = no
always_keep_download = no
plugin_repository_last_check_duration = 60
disable_plugin_short_name_repository = no
concurrency = auto
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing ASDF Environment Variables Shell
DESCRIPTION: Displays environment variables related to asdf for a given command or utility via `asdf env <command> [util]`. This helps users understand the environment context used by asdf shims and tools. Requires an asdf installation with configured plugins and tools. Inputs are the target command and optional utility name, outputs environment-related information useful for debugging or configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/manage/core.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf env <command> [util]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configure asdf custom data directory for Nushell Nushell
DESCRIPTION: Specifies a custom directory for asdf data in Nushell. This overrides the default `$HOME/.asdf` location. This line should be added to `~/.config/nushell/config.nu` before the shims path configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: Nushell
CODE:
```
$env.ASDF_DATA_DIR = "/your/custom/data/dir"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing installed versions of a tool
DESCRIPTION: Shows versions of a tool currently installed via asdf, optionally filtered by a specific version pattern. Depend on asdf and plugin configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ko-kr/manage/versions.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf list <name>
# Example: asdf list erlang
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting asdf tool versions globally, locally, or for shell sessions - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to set the active version of a tool using asdf globally (writes to $HOME/.tool-versions), locally (writes to .tool-versions in current directory), or for the current shell session only (environment variables). Accepts multiple versions or the special 'latest[:version]' syntax. This allows flexible version control per context.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/zh-hans/manage/versions.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf global <name> <version> [<version>...]
asdf shell <name> <version> [<version>...]
asdf local <name> <version> [<version>...]
# asdf global elixir 1.2.4

asdf global <name> latest[:<version>]
asdf local <name> latest[:<version>]
# asdf global elixir latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing All Plugin Shortnames in asdf
DESCRIPTION: This command retrieves all shortnames for plugins supported by the plugin repository, which helps in identifying available plugins for installation or update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/manage/plugins.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf plugin list all
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring POSIX Shell with Homebrew
DESCRIPTION: This snippet adds commands to ~/.profile to set ASDF_DIR from Homebrew prefix and source asdf.sh for POSIX shells on systems using Homebrew.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started-legacy.md#_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
echo -e "\nexport ASDF_DIR=\"$(brew --prefix asdf)/libexec/asdf.sh\"" >> ~/.profile\necho -e "\n. \"$(brew --prefix asdf)/libexec/asdf.sh\"" >> ~/.profile
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering all available versions by pattern
DESCRIPTION: Displays all remote versions that start with the given pattern, assisting in version discovery and updates, after querying plugin version data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ko-kr/manage/versions.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf list all <name> <version>
# Example: asdf list all erlang 17
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic .tool-versions File Example
DESCRIPTION: Example of a .tool-versions file specifying versions for Ruby and Node.js. This file controls which tool versions are used in the directory where it's placed and its subdirectories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/manage/configuration.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ruby 2.5.3
nodejs 10.15.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing All Available Versions with ASDF
DESCRIPTION: Shows all versions available for installation for a specific tool. Can optionally filter results to show only versions starting with a given string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/manage/versions.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf list all <name>
# asdf list all erlang
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf list all <name> <version>
# asdf list all erlang 17
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Local Tool Version with asdf
DESCRIPTION: This command sets the local version of a tool (e.g., nodejs) using asdf. It modifies the `$PWD/.tool-versions` file (current working directory). The `latest` keyword instructs asdf to use the latest available version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/zh-hans/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf local nodejs latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Contents of .tool-versions File
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the format of the `.tool-versions` file, which contains the tool name and version, used by asdf to determine which version of a tool to use. The command or configuration writes the specified tool version into this file for environment management.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$HOME/.tool-versions
nodejs 16.5.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing asdf Packages (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Installs package versions. Can install all versions from the `.tool-versions` file, a single tool's version from `.tool-versions`, a specific version number, or the latest stable version (optionally matching a prefix like 'latest:16').
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/help.txt#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
asdf install
asdf install <name>
asdf install <name> <version>
asdf install <name> latest[:<version>]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing asdf Plugin for Node.js via Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the `nodejs` plugin for asdf from its GitHub repository. It requires that the asdf tool is already installed and configured. The plugin enables managing Node.js versions through asdf.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf plugin add nodejs https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf-nodejs.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing the Latest Node.js Version
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the latest available version of Node.js using asdf. It requires the asdf-nodejs plugin to be installed. The command downloads and installs the newest Node.js release. The expected output is the installation of the latest Node.js version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started-legacy.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf install nodejs latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing all available versions of a tool with asdf - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to list all remotely available versions of a given tool supported by asdf, optionally filtered by a version prefix. This helps users identify which versions can be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/zh-hans/manage/versions.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf list all <name>
# asdf list all erlang
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf list all <name> <version>
# asdf list all erlang 17
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add shims to PATH (ZSH)
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the PATH environment variable in .zshrc. This is a necessary step for asdf to manage tool versions. The shims directory is located under the ASDF_DATA_DIR, which defaults to $HOME/.asdf, if not set explicitly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
export PATH="${ASDF_DATA_DIR:-$HOME/.asdf}/shims:$PATH"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Installed ASDF Plugins
DESCRIPTION: This command lists all currently installed ASDF plugins. It provides an overview of the tools managed by ASDF.  No parameters are required.  The output displays the names of the installed plugins.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/zh-hans/manage/plugins.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf plugin list
# asdf plugin list
# java
# nodejs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Installed asdf Plugins
DESCRIPTION: Displays a list of all plugins currently installed in the asdf environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/manage/plugins.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf plugin list
# asdf plugin list
# java
# nodejs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing latest stable version of a tool with asdf
DESCRIPTION: Uses 'latest' keyword in asdf install to fetch and install the most recent stable version of a tool. Needs the tool's plugin and internet connectivity to retrieve available versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ko-kr/manage/versions.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf install <name> latest
# Example: asdf install erlang latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring VitePress Homepage Layout for asdf in Korean
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for the asdf-vm homepage using VitePress. It defines the hero section with Korean text and multiple action buttons, along with six feature sections highlighting asdf's capabilities as a runtime version manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ko-kr/index.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# https://vitepress.dev/reference/default-theme-home-page
layout: home

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding ASDF Plugin with Git URL
DESCRIPTION: This command adds a new ASDF plugin using its Git URL. It enables ASDF to manage versions of a specific tool.  Requires the tool's Git repository URL. The `<name>` parameter specifies the plugin's identifier, and `<git-url>` is the Git repository URL of the plugin. The command adds the plugin, allowing you to install and manage versions of the associated tool. This is the recommended approach.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/zh-hans/manage/plugins.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf plugin add <name> <git-url>
# asdf plugin add elm https://github.com/vic/asdf-elm
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add asdf to ZSH config (Git)
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf initialization script to the ~/.zshrc file, ensuring asdf is available in new ZSH shell sessions when installed via git.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started-legacy.md#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
. "$HOME/.asdf/asdf.sh"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing an asdf Plugin
DESCRIPTION: Removes a specified plugin along with all tool versions installed by that plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/manage/plugins.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
asdf plugin remove <name>
# asdf plugin remove erlang
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configure asdf shims path for ZSH Shell
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the system's PATH environment variable in ZSH. This allows the shell to find executables managed by asdf. This line should be added to the user's `~/.zshrc`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
export PATH="${ASDF_DATA_DIR:-$HOME/.asdf}/shims:$PATH"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing an ASDF Plugin
DESCRIPTION: This command removes a specified ASDF plugin.  This will remove the plugin and all tools installed by that plugin. Requires the plugin's name as input.  The `<name>` parameter indicates the plugin to be removed. This also cleans up any associated tool versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/zh-hans/manage/plugins.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf plugin remove <name>
# asdf plugin remove erlang
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing a Specific Tool Version with asdf (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Installs a specific version of a tool using `asdf install`. Replace `<name>` with the tool name (e.g., `erlang`) and `<version>` with the desired version number (e.g., `17.3`). Also supports installing from source using `ref:` for branches, tags, or commits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/manage/versions.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf install <name> <version>
# asdf install erlang 17.3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Selecting the Current Tool Version with asdf (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Sets the current version(s) for a tool using `asdf global`, `asdf shell`, or `asdf local`. `global` writes to `$HOME/.tool-versions`, `shell` sets `ASDF_${LANG}_VERSION` for the current session, and `local` writes to `$PWD/.tool-versions`. Supports specific versions, multiple versions space-separated, or `latest[:<prefix>]`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/manage/versions.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf global <name> <version> [<version>...]
asdf shell <name> <version> [<version>...]
asdf local <name> <version> [<version>...]
# asdf global elixir 1.2.4

asdf global <name> latest[:<version>]
asdf local <name> latest[:<version>]
# asdf global elixir latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Available Versions Matching Prefix with asdf (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Lists available versions of a tool that start with a specific prefix using `asdf list all <name> <version>`. Replace `<name>` with the tool name (e.g., `erlang`) and `<version>` with the prefix (e.g., `17`).
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/manage/versions.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf list all <name> <version>
# asdf list all erlang 17
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Add shims to PATH (POSIX)
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the PATH environment variable in .profile. This is a necessary step for asdf to manage tool versions. The shims directory is located under the ASDF_DATA_DIR, which defaults to $HOME/.asdf, if not set explicitly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
export PATH="${ASDF_DATA_DIR:-$HOME/.asdf}/shims:$PATH"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting ASDF_DIR Environment Variable
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to configure the ASDF_DIR environment variable. This variable specifies the location of the asdf core scripts. The path must be absolute.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/manage/configuration.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
export ASDF_DIR=/home/john_doe/.config/asdf
```

TITLE: Listing Shim Versions with asdf
DESCRIPTION: The `asdf shimversions` command lists the plugins and versions providing shims for a given command.  This helps in understanding which tool versions are available for a particular command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/manage/core.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf shimversions <command>
```

TITLE: Finding ASDF Command Path Shell
DESCRIPTION: Display the absolute path to the executable file for a given command, as resolved by ASDF's shims for the current environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/internal/help/help.txt#_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
asdf which <command>
```

DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the system's PATH environment variable in Bash. This allows the shell to find executables managed by asdf. This line should be added to the user's `~/.bash_profile`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Shell

```
export PATH="${ASDF_DATA_DIR:-$HOME/.asdf}/shims:$PATH"
```

TITLE: Configuring PowerShell Core to source asdf
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to source the asdf PowerShell script in your PowerShell profile to enable asdf command-line integration and version management within PowerShell Core.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started-legacy.md#_snippet_23

```

LANGUAGE: shell

asdf plugin list

# java
# nodejs
```

TITLE: Setting ASDF Tool Version Shell
DESCRIPTION: Set a tool version in a `.tool-versions` file in the current directory or a parent. Use `-u` to unset a version or `-p` to specify the path to the file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/internal/help/help.txt#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
asdf set [-u] [-p] <name> <versions...>
```

TITLE: Uninstalling a Version with ASDF
DESCRIPTION: Removes a specific version of a tool that was previously installed with ASDF.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/manage/versions.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```

# asdf uninstall erlang 17.3
```

TITLE: Setting Tool Version via Environment Variable
DESCRIPTION: Sets a tool version using an environment variable, which overrides .tool-versions settings. This approach only affects the current shell session or command execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/manage/versions.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
export ASDF_ELIXIR_VERSION=1.18.1
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
ASDF_ELIXIR_VERSION=1.4.0 mix test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configure asdf completions source for ZSH Shell
DESCRIPTION: Configures ZSH to load the asdf completion script by adding its directory to `fpath` and initializing completions. This block should be added to the user's `~/.zshrc` after any framework sourcing. Requires the completion files to have been generated.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: ZSH
CODE:
```
# append completions to fpath
fpath=(${ASDF_DATA_DIR:-$HOME/.asdf}/completions $fpath)
# initialise completions with ZSH's compinit
autoload -Uz compinit && compinit
```

TITLE: Configure asdf Bash Completions (Git macOS)
DESCRIPTION: This command adds the asdf completion script to the ~/.bash_profile file to enable tab completion for asdf commands. It depends on asdf being installed via git. Used in macOS Catalina or newer if not using ZSH.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started-legacy.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
. "$HOME/.asdf/completions/asdf.bash"
```

LANGUAGE: Shell

DESCRIPTION: Displays the current active versions for all tools or a specific tool, indicating which versions are in use in the current context and their configuration files.

TITLE: Install asdf plugin
DESCRIPTION: Adds a plugin to asdf. This example adds the nodejs plugin. Requires a valid URL for the plugin repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```

TITLE: Using asdf exec to run commands with shims
DESCRIPTION: Runs executables via asdf's shim system, which delegates to the appropriate version based on current configuration, ensuring environment consistency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ko-kr/manage/versions.md#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# returns path to main executable in current version
source $(asdf which ${PLUGIN})/../script.sh

# returns path to the package installation directory
source $(asdf where ${PLUGIN})/bin/script.sh
```

TITLE: Add asdf to Bash profile (Homebrew)
DESCRIPTION: Adds asdf initialization script to the ~/.bashrc using the path provided by `brew --prefix asdf`.  This ensures asdf is available in new terminal sessions when installed via Homebrew.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started-legacy.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
echo -e "\n. \"$(brew --prefix asdf)/libexec/asdf.sh\"" >> ~/.bashrc
```

TITLE: Checking Current Tool Versions with asdf (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Displays the currently active versions for all tools managed by `asdf` using `asdf current`, or for a specific tool using `asdf current <name>`. The output includes the version number and the configuration file (`.tool-versions`) that defines it.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/manage/versions.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
asdf current
# asdf current
# erlang 17.3 (set by /Users/kim/.tool-versions)
# nodejs 6.11.5 (set by /Users/kim/cool-node-project/.tool-versions)

asdf current <name>
# asdf current erlang
# 17.3 (set by /Users/kim/.tool-versions)
```

TITLE: Configure asdf shims path for PowerShell Core PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the system's PATH environment variable in PowerShell Core. It dynamically determines the shims path based on the `ASDF_DATA_DIR` variable. This block should be added to `~/.config/powershell/profile.ps1`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: PowerShell
CODE:
```
# Determine the location of the shims directory
if ($null -eq $ASDF_DATA_DIR -or $ASDF_DATA_DIR -eq '') {
  $_asdf_shims = "${env:HOME}/.asdf/shims"
}
else {
  $_asdf_shims = "$ASDF_DATA_DIR/shims"
}

# Then add it to path
$env:PATH = "${_asdf_shims}:${env:PATH}"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Nushell completion setup
DESCRIPTION: Configures command completion for Nushell. This involves creating completions directory, generating completion script and adding a line to the config.nu file. This is an optional setup for easier asdf usage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# If you've not customized the asdf data directory:
$ mkdir $"($env.HOME)/.asdf/completions"
$ asdf completion nushell | save $"($env.HOME)/.asdf/completions/nushell.nu"

# If you have customized the data directory by setting ASDF_DATA_DIR:
$ mkdir $"($env.ASDF_DATA_DIR)/completions"
$ asdf completion nushell | save $"($env.ASDF_DATA_DIR)/completions/nushell.nu"

# add the completion file
let asdf_data_dir = (
  if ( $env | get --ignore-errors ASDF_DATA_DIR | is-empty ) {
    $env.HOME | path join '.asdf'
  } else {
    $env.ASDF_DATA_DIR
  }
)
. "$asdf_data_dir/completions/nushell.nu"
```

TITLE: Add asdf to Elvish config (Git)
DESCRIPTION: Configures asdf for Elvish shell by creating the lib directory, creating symlink for asdf.elv, and adding the necessary lines to rc.elv. Assumes git installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started-legacy.md#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
mkdir -p ~/.config/elvish/lib; ln -s ~/.asdf/asdf.elv ~/.config/elvish/lib/asdf.elv
echo "\n"'use asdf _asdf; var asdf~ = $_asdf:asdf~' >> ~/.config/elvish/rc.elv
echo "\n"'set edit:completion:arg-completer[asdf] = $_asdf:arg-completer~' >> ~/.config/elvish/rc.elv
```

TITLE: Locating Tool Executable/Installation Paths with asdf (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using `asdf which ${PLUGIN}` to find the path to the currently active tool executable managed by shims, and `asdf where ${PLUGIN} $(asdf current ${PLUGIN})` to find the installation directory of the current version. This is useful for sourcing scripts directly from the installation, bypassing shims. Replace `${PLUGIN}` with the tool name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/manage/versions.md#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# retorna o 'path' da vers√£o atual em execu√ß√£o
source $(asdf which ${PLUGIN})/../script.sh

TITLE: Add shims to PATH (PowerShell)
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the PATH environment variable in PowerShell's profile.ps1 file.  This is a necessary step for asdf to manage tool versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Determine the location of the shims directory
if ($null -eq $ASDF_DATA_DIR -or $ASDF_DATA_DIR -eq '') {
  $_asdf_shims = "${env:HOME}/.asdf/shims"
}
else {

}

# Then add it to path

```

TITLE: Add shims to PATH (Elvish)
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the PATH environment variable in Elvish shell's rc.elv file.  This is a necessary step for asdf to manage tool versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
var asdf_data_dir = ~'/.asdf'
if (and (has-env ASDF_DATA_DIR) (!=s $E:ASDF_DATA_DIR '')) {
  set asdf_data_dir = $E:ASDF_DATA_DIR
}

if (not (has-value $paths $asdf_data_dir'/shims')) {

TITLE: Configurable Command Hooks with asdf (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet showcases how to configure command hooks within the `.asdfrc` file. These hooks allow users to execute custom commands before and after specific asdf actions, such as installing, reshimming, or uninstalling tools, as well as before and after executing commands from a plugin. The arguments passed to these commands are specified by `${@}`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
pre_asdf_install_foo = echo will install foo version ${1}
post_asdf_install_foo = echo installed foo version ${1}

pre_asdf_reshim_foo = echo will reshim foo version ${1}
post_asdf_reshim_foo = echo reshimmed foo version ${1}

pre_foo_bar = echo about to execute command bar from foo with args: ${@}
post_foo_bar = echo just executed command bar from foo with args: ${@}

pre_asdf_uninstall_foo = echo will remove foo version ${1}
post_asdf_uninstall_foo = echo removed foo version ${1}
```

TITLE: Debugging Bats Tests with TAP Output (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates a technique for printing debugging output within a Bats test script using the TAP format. Output directed to file descriptor `>&3` is visible when running Bats with the `-t` flag, aiding in troubleshooting test failures. Requires Bats to be installed and the test file to be executed with the `-t` flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/contribute/core.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
# test/some_tests.bats

printf "%s\n" "Will not be printed during bats test/some_tests.bats"
printf "%s\n" "Will be printed during bats -t test/some_tests.bats" >&3
```

TITLE: Setting asdf Environment Variables in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Environment variables allow overriding asdf's default configuration and data file locations, concurrency for compilation, and PATH handling. Variables like ASDF_CONFIG_FILE, ASDF_DEFAULT_TOOL_VERSIONS_FILENAME, ASDF_DIR, ASDF_DATA_DIR, ASDF_CONCURRENCY, and ASDF_FORCE_PREPEND control file locations, naming, parallelism, and shim path precedence respectively. Properly exporting these variables prior to sourcing asdf shell scripts is required for effect.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/manage/configuration.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export ASDF_CONFIG_FILE=/home/john_doe/.config/asdf/.asdfrc
export ASDF_DEFAULT_TOOL_VERSIONS_FILENAME=tool_versions
export ASDF_DIR=/home/john_doe/.config/asdf
export ASDF_DATA_DIR=/home/john_doe/.asdf
export ASDF_CONCURRENCY=32
ASDF_FORCE_PREPEND=no . "<path-to-asdf-directory>/asdf.sh"
```

TITLE: Add shims to PATH (Nushell)
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the PATH environment variable in Nushell's config.nu file.  This is a necessary step for asdf to manage tool versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
let shims_dir = (
  if ( $env | get --ignore-errors ASDF_DATA_DIR | is-empty ) {
    $env.HOME | path join '.asdf'
  } else {
    $env.ASDF_DATA_DIR
  } | path join 'shims'
)
$env.PATH = ( $env.PATH | split row (char esep) | where { |p| $p != $shims_dir } | prepend $shims_dir )
```

TITLE: Configure asdf shims path for Nushell Nushell
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the system's PATH environment variable in Nushell. It handles both default and custom `ASDF_DATA_DIR` locations. This block should be added to `~/.config/nushell/config.nu`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: Nushell
CODE:
```
let shims_dir = (
  if ( $env | get --ignore-errors ASDF_DATA_DIR | is-empty ) {
    $env.HOME | path join '.asdf'
  } else {
    $env.ASDF_DATA_DIR
  } | path join 'shims'
)
$env.PATH = ( $env.PATH | split row (char esep) | where { |p| $p != $shims_dir } | prepend $shims_dir )
```

TITLE: Configure asdf shims path for Fish Shell
DESCRIPTION: Adds the asdf shims directory to the system's PATH environment variable in Fish shell. It checks for the `ASDF_DATA_DIR` variable and ensures the shims path is added correctly. This block should be added to `~/.config/fish/config.fish`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Fish
CODE:
```
# ASDF configuration code
if test -z $ASDF_DATA_DIR
    set _asdf_shims "$HOME/.asdf/shims"
else
    set _asdf_shims "$ASDF_DATA_DIR/shims"
end

# Do not use fish_add_path (added in Fish 3.2) because it
# potentially changes the order of items in PATH
if not contains $_asdf_shims $PATH
    set -gx --prepend PATH $_asdf_shims
end
set --erase _asdf_shims
```

TITLE: GitHub Actions Workflow for asdf Plugin Test
DESCRIPTION: This is a sample GitHub Actions workflow file (`.github/workflows/test.yaml`) for testing asdf plugins. It defines a job that runs on both Ubuntu and macOS, using the `asdf-vm/actions/plugin-test` action to test the plugin.

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: Test
on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  plugin_test:
    name: asdf plugin test
    strategy:
      matrix:
        os:
          - ubuntu-latest
          - macos-latest
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    steps:
      - name: asdf_plugin_test
        uses: asdf-vm/actions/plugin-test@v2
        with:
          command: "<MY_TOOL> --version"
```

TITLE: ZSH completion setup
DESCRIPTION: Configures command completion for ZSH. This involves creating the completions directory, generating a completion script, and adding it to the fpath and initializing completion.  This is an optional setup for easier asdf usage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/guide/getting-started.md#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ mkdir -p "${ASDF_DATA_DIR:-$HOME/.asdf}/completions"
$ asdf completion zsh > "${ASDF_DATA_DIR:-$HOME/.asdf}/completions/_asdf"
# append completions to fpath
fpath=(${ASDF_DATA_DIR:-$HOME/.asdf}/completions $fpath)
# initialise completions with ZSH's compinit
autoload -Uz compinit && compinit
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```

 cmd="$cmd -H 'Authorization: token $GITHUB_API_TOKEN'"
fi

cmd="$cmd $releases_path"
```

TITLE: GitHub Action for asdf plugin test
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet configures a GitHub Action workflow to test an asdf plugin. It specifies the workflow name, trigger events (push and pull request), the operating systems to test on, and uses the `asdf-vm/actions/plugin-test@v2` action to run the plugin tests. The `command` parameter specifies the command to run to verify the plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ko-kr/plugins/create.md#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: Test
  on:
    push:
      branches:
        - main
    pull_request:

  jobs:
    plugin_test:
      name: asdf plugin test
      strategy:
        matrix:
          os:
            - ubuntu-latest
            - macos-latest
      runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
      steps:
        - name: asdf_plugin_test
          uses: asdf-vm/actions/plugin-test@v2
          with:
            command: "<MY_TOOL> --version"
```

TITLE: Debugging BATS Tests with TAP Output - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to write BATS test scripts to facilitate debugging by printing output selectively. Using the special file descriptor '&>3' within the test allows output to be shown only when running bats with the '-t' flag, avoiding clutter during normal test runs. This technique helps in diagnosing test failures while following bats-core documentation conventions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/pt-br/contribute/core.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# test/some_tests.bats

printf "%s\n" "Will not be printed during bats test/some_tests.bats"
printf "%s\n" "Will be printed during bats -t test/some_tests.bats" >&3
```

TITLE: Configuring GitLens in VSCode for Blame Ignore Revisions - JSON
DESCRIPTION: Shows a JSON settings block for Visual Studio Code, which configures the GitLens extension to always pass the --ignore-revs-file and .git-blame-ignore-revs file to git blame. Requires GitLens and an existing .git-blame-ignore-revs file. Should be placed inside .vscode/settings.json for per-project configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/contribute/core.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "gitlens.advanced.blame.customArguments": [
    "--ignore-revs-file",
    ".git-blame-ignore-revs"
  ]
}

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring git blame to Ignore Specific Revisions - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates invoking git blame with the --ignore-revs-file flag and configuring git globally to always use .git-blame-ignore-revs. Used to reduce noise in blame results for bulk changes or formatting commits. Requires git and the .git-blame-ignore-revs file to exist in the repository root; can also be adopted into development IDEs for improved review clarity.
SOURCE: https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf/blob/master/docs/ja-jp/contribute/core.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git blame --ignore-revs-file .git-blame-ignore-revs ./test/install_command.bats

```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git config blame.ignoreRevsFile .git-blame-ignore-revs

```
